name: Kingdom Bounce
description:
► Shoot, defend and beware... of BOB!

In Kingdom Bounce you have to defend your castle against hordes of monsters, and for that you have your trusty cannon! The only thing is: your cannon shoots SOLDIERS! (And your soldiers bounce of the walls and stuff, so you know, that is why the name of the game. Yeah, I knew you would get it, thank you! :B)

What awaits for you: (Read out loud with an announcer voice and have fun! Or don't!)

✪ 48 Stars to achieve and complete the game!
✪ 48 Challenges to unlock stuff and also complete the game! (awesome!)
✪ 21 Soldiers each one with different stats! Some are cute, some are brute but everyone is amazing! (not really!!)
✪ 16 Levels of pure bounciness and monsters to shoot!
✪ 16 Levels descriptions packed with fun! And references! And somewhat of a story!
✪ 2 Characters that do not speak a word, but maybe one day will!
✪ 1 BOB! He is the villain of the game, I'm sorry if I wasn't clear before!

And also:

✪ Rename your Soldiers and put your friends in the game! Or your cat, who cares?!
✪ Did I said that you can SHOOT them after this? Yeah, shoot your friends! Or cat!
✪ Full localized to EN and PT-BR (if your browser is in any other language, it defaults to EN)
✪ Original music and sound effects made by our member Sir V, the Dark Knight! Nobody calls him that way!
✪ A lot of unique art made by our member Chejar Balfur, the Barbarian!
✪ A lot of lines of code, that you will never see, made by ours members Big Mage Victor and Matheus. Yeah, just Matheus!

Thank you for reading all this! Here, take this GRATITUTE!! (*You got the gratitute!*)

Hope you had fun with this silly description :)
But wait, there is more fun waiting for you inside this game! Yay!

---------------------------------------------

2019 RELEASE NOTES

This game was originally released for Android on the Google Play Store on Jun/2016.

Developed by four friends in six months for the final project of college, our first big project. It was really fun and I do miss those times.

Building it to WebGL wasn't as easy as I thought it would be, and it actually made me spend several hours to fix a lot of things. So, if you encounter any bugs, as it is bound to happen (hahaha), contact me!
